column4: so I'm here in winxp because ubuntu for some reason doesn't see the wireless here.
I suspect that it may be that it's latching onto one of the secured wireless etworks in the area and not onto the public network.
What can I do to control this?
So speaking of human beings, any advice on my wireless question?
does iwlist scan show several networks?
so configure the essid channel etc with iwconfig
hm, Okay, I'll give that a shot.
once associated, dhclient <iface> or ifconfig <iface> to configure the interface
you could write a shell func
Yeah, would probably be a good idea.
or ~/shell_trash or whatever, perhaps - /tmp gets cleaned up at boot time IIRC
essid channel/freq mode etc are correct?
perhaps you have something like waproamd running that's trying to associate to the wrong network?
the gui network config prog may be interfering?
